args.short_desc: Specify a filename to use. Default: ${hostn}-bkp.img
Specify a mount point for your local storage device. Default: /mnt/usbstorage
Specify a local storage device to backup to. The script will try to find one if unspecified.
Specify a location to output the log to. Default: /var/log/auxcli.pi.backup.log

Enable shrinking. Optional: Specify a string to append to the filename. Default: "-shrunk" Shrinking requires a device with at least 2x the storage space as your boot drive. NOTE: Sometimes drives are labeled incorrectly so double check. Actual storage might be slightly over or under the storage advertised. So 2x 4GB might not fit on an 8GB USB.
Enable zipping the backup before moving it to its final destination. For simplicity's sake, it follows the storage requirements for shrinking.
